SEARCH
Module com.example.umlscd
Package com.example.umlscd.Models.ClassDiagram

Interface UMLElementBoxInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
UMLClassBox, UMLInterfaceBox
public interface UMLElementBoxInterface

UML Element Box Interface

The UMLElementBoxInterface defines a contract for UML element boxes within the UML Editor application. This interface ensures that all UML elements, such as classes and interfaces, provide consistent methods for accessing and modifying their fundamental properties. By implementing this interface, different UML elements can be managed uniformly, facilitating operations like serialization, rendering, and user interactions.

Key functionalities include:

  • Retrieving the name of the UML element.
  • Accessing and updating the X and Y coordinates of the element on the drawing pane.
  • Obtaining and setting the visual representation of the element as a VBox.

Authors: Ahmad Wyne, Wahaj Asif, Muhammad Muneeb

Version: 1.0

Since: 2024-12-03

  • Method Details

    • getName

      String getName()
      Retrieves the name of the UML element.

      This method returns the identifier name of the UML element, such as the class name or interface name.

      Returns:
      A String representing the name of the UML element.

    • getX

      double getX()
      Retrieves the X-coordinate position of the UML element on the drawing pane.

      This method returns the horizontal position of the UML element within the diagram's canvas.

      Returns:
      A double value indicating the X-coordinate.

    • getY

      double getY()
      Retrieves the Y-coordinate position of the UML element on the drawing pane.

      This method returns the vertical position of the UML element within the diagram's canvas.

      Returns:
      A double value indicating the Y-coordinate.

    • getVisualRepresentation

      javafx.scene.layout.VBox getVisualRepresentation()
      Retrieves the visual representation of the UML element.

      This method returns the VBox that visually represents the UML element in the user interface. The VBox contains all necessary UI components to display the element's details.

      Returns:
      A VBox representing the UML element's visual appearance.

    • setName

      void setName(String name)
      Sets the name of the UML element.

      This method updates the identifier name of the UML element, such as changing a class name or interface name in the diagram.

      Parameters:
      name - A String containing the new name for the UML element.

    • setX

      void setX(double x)
      Sets the X-coordinate position of the UML element on the drawing pane.

      This method updates the horizontal position of the UML element within the diagram's canvas.

      Parameters:
      x - A double value indicating the new X-coordinate.

    • setY

      void setY(double y)
      Sets the Y-coordinate position of the UML element on the drawing pane.

      This method updates the vertical position of the UML element within the diagram's canvas.

      Parameters:
      y - A double value indicating the new Y-coordinate.

    • setVisualRepresentation

      void setVisualRepresentation(javafx.scene.layout.VBox visualRepresentation)
      Sets the visual representation of the UML element.

      This method updates the VBox that visually represents the UML element in the user interface. It allows for dynamic changes to the element's appearance based on user interactions or other operations.

      Parameters:
      visualRepresentation - A VBox representing the new visual appearance of the UML element.
